米.definition: uncooked rice; meter (unit of length); (slang) Chinese yuan

米兔.definition: (Internet slang) (loanword) #MeToo (movement against sexual harassment and assault)

米利班德.definition: Milliband (name); Ed Milliband, UK labor politician, opposition leader from 2010

米哈伊爾·普羅霍羅夫.pinyin: Mi3 ha1 yi1 er3 · Pu3 luo2 huo4 luo2 fu1
米哈伊爾·普羅霍羅夫.definition: Mikhail Prokhorov (1965-), Russian billionaire and owner of the Brooklyn Nets (NBA team)

米國.definition: United States; name of a country that formerly existed near Samarkand

米夫.definition: Pavel Aleksandrovich Mif (1901-1938), Ukrainian Soviet expert on Chinese affairs, secretly executed in Stalin's purges

米字旗.definition: Union Jack (flag of the United Kingdom)

米已成炊.definition: lit. the rice has already been cooked (idiom); fig. what is done cannot be undone

米易.definition: Miyi county in Panzhihua 攀枝花[Pan1 zhi1 hua1], south Sichuan

米易縣.definition: Miyi county in Panzhihua 攀枝花[Pan1 zhi1 hua1], south Sichuan

米歇爾.definition: Michel or Mitchell (name); George Mitchell (1933-), US Democratic party politician and diplomat, influential in brokering Northern Ireland peace deal in 1990s, US Middle East special envoy from 2009

米湯.definition: water in which rice has been boiled and then strained out

米爾頓.definition: Milton (name); John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost

米粉.definition: rice flour; rice-flour noodles; (Internet slang) Xiaomi fan

米脂.definition: Mizhi County in Yulin 榆林[Yu2 lin2], Shaanxi

米脂縣.definition: Mizhi County in Yulin 榆林[Yu2 lin2], Shaanxi

米芾.definition: Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher

米袋子.definition: (fig.) supply of grain to the public

米開朗基羅.definition: Michelangelo Buonarroti (1475-1564), Renaissance painter and sculptor

米高揚.definition: Mikoyan (name); Anastas Ivanonovich Mikoyan (1895-1978), Soviet politician, politburo member in the 1950s and 1960s; Artem Ivanovich Mikoyan (1905-1970), brother of the politician and one designer of MiG military aircraft

米麵.definition: rice and noodles; rice flour; rice-flour noodles
